editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create it—anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. That’s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojang’s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Ready for something a bit different? Plague Inc. challenges you to strategically spread and evolve diseases. While the concept isn't exactly honorable, the surprising ways all these novel gameplay systems interact make this twist on traditional heroism a lot of fun — even though it shouldn’t be.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: It’s one thing to say you’d never take a bribe: It’s quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. That’s but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.
Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp lives on! This offline version of the beloved management sim includes all the original content, plus a few new surprises.

An intriguing genre blend, Terraria mixes collection, construction, and combat in a retro-styled 2D adventure. Break apart the world, uncovering rare treasures and digging deep underground for resources to build elaborate houses. Then craft powerful weapons and armor before facing bizarre, fantastical creatures. It’s a huge, sophisticated experience that’s easy to spend hours with—a universe of densely layered surprises, where every session is exciting.
What happens after a zombie apocalypse? Find out by intuitively rebuilding civilization in this slick sequel to Plague Inc.

Your starship is outgunned and on the run from a fleet of rebel forces; can you make it home alive? A space-combat experience of remarkable depth, FTL's elegant, interlocking gameplay systems generate moments of remarkable tension and reward. As your vessel leapfrogs between galaxies, you’ll manage a crew, extinguish engine-room fires, target enemy shield generators with energy weapons, and equip powerful upgrades so you can plunge deeper into the uncharted cosmos. It’s a constant cycle of surprise and excitement, augmented by the game’s stylish presentation and irresistible charm.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Harvest crops of olives, grapes, and sorghum for the first time in this long-running sim series that lets you really dig into the details of virtual farming.

ios.subtitle: It’s not a bug, it’s a feature

editorialNotes.standard: We love dropping into this city builder’s immersive third-person view, which lets us stroll through bustling neighborhoods of our own creation.

You’re a goat, free to run wild and cause mayhem in a virtual town. And trust us: that premise leads to tons of hilarious moments and stunts. We’ve crashed parties, head-butted cars, bounced on trampolines, and done a million other goofy things in this outrageous sandbox game.

Build the perfect commute on your next commute with the hypnotic Mini Metro. Strategy buffs and casual gamers alike will enjoy expanding a busy transit system by linking stations, directing trains, and upgrading lines. There’s a thrilling satisfaction in seeing subways come together—and since no two games play alike, we’re always trying out new designs.
editorialNotes.short: Construct the perfect commute in this underground masterpiece.

editorialNotes.tagline: From the creator of Plague Inc.

editorialNotes.standard: If you’re going to wage Total War, you better have a total strategy. Feral’s faithful port takes us right back to the amazingly complex battles of Rome. We can’t help but make alliances, purposely break them, then chase down our newfound enemies. It’s all fun and games, right? That is, until they get the upper hand…

ios.subtitle: Build your own city as mayor!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: With its unique take on world domination, Sid Meier’s Civilization has captured gamers’ imaginations for more than 20 years. Civilization Revolution 2 carries the franchise’s winning formula to iPhone and iPad, expanding on its predecessor with a new arsenal of troops, technologies, and characters. Complex tactics and gorgeous 3D design make each match a pleasure as players expand their empire, make allies, and declare war using famous leaders ranging from Napoleon to JFK.

ios.subtitle: You won't be able to stop.

editorialNotes.standard: I Am Bread is a little like the childhood game Hot Lava: you’re trying to reach objectives without touching the ground. The twist? You’re a piece of bread, and the surfaces you’re flopping toward are ones you can toast yourself on. As you hop through kitchens and bathrooms, you’ll need to avoid icky stuff like dirty socks and dishwater that’ll make you less edible. Between levels, you get snapshots of your homeowner’s mental state as he slowly realizes what’s continually trashing his place. The whole experience is inexplicable and delightfully weird.
editorialNotes.short: This wholemeal hero just wants to be toasted.

editorialNotes.standard: We love how Moncage’s puzzles show the importance of seeing things from different perspectives. The storytelling vignettes packed into the faces of a rotating cube connect and combine in ever-evolving, surprising ways, and the challenge of making those connections sparks creativity and renders the impossible suddenly possible. Rarely has the concept of thinking outside the box been illustrated so well.

ios.subtitle: Adopt a family in your pocket!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The world’s most ridiculous goat is back in this hilarious massively multiplayer online game. From the very start, it’s obvious this isn’t your typical MMO. It all begins with you choosing one of six classes—which run the gamut from Magician to Microwave (seriously)—then embarking on bizarre quests. Like its predecessors, the game comes chock full of meta jokes, lovably preserved glitches, and destructible environments while boasting incredibly impressive landscapes and entertaining gameplay.

ios.subtitle: Live the life of a real dog!

editorialNotes.standard: Find food for your cubs in treacherous environments as the last living mother fox in this emotionally charged adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Get behind the wheel of the world’s fastest cars in this graphical powerhouse—and experience a singularly cool documentary-like career mode.

GoatZ poses a simple question: How long can you survive the apocalypse … as a zombie goat? This hilariously absurd follow-up to Goat Simulator takes tons of survival-game conventions—like crafting, time-based challenges, and a big, open world—and wraps them together in a package intentionally littered with glitches. As you make your way around town, licking trash cans and head-butting zombies, the ridiculous bugs and hysterical premise will have you laughing out loud. It’s dumb fun in the best way.

editorialNotes.tagline: The sky is not the limit
